His family members and teachers think this is strange, and they tell him that he should choose only one religion because most people believe you cannot follow three different religions together. However, Pi disagrees with them because he feels that all these religions help him love God in different ways, and he doesn't want to give up any of them.

After Pi explains his feelings about religion, his family and teachers realize that they cannot change his mind. Although they still think his choice is unusual, they decide they will let him choose what he believes about religion by himself, since his faith seems genuine and important to him.

Some people believe that if you write down your dreams, it might help you have lucid dreams. Lucid dreams are special dreams where you know that you are dreaming while the dream is happening. When you have this type of dream, you can also make choices that change what happens in your dream.

For example, you could turn a scary nightmare into a dream that feels safe and comfortable. You could also control your dream story like a movie director controls a film. However, you should probably still have some normal dreams too. These regular dreams are important because they let your subconscious mind show you what you are really thinking about. So instead of just trying to understand what your dreams mean after you wake up, you would actually be making your own dreams while you sleep.

People might not know they are part of the throwaway clothing problem because they give their old clothes to charity shops. However, these charity shops cannot sell all the clothes that people bring to them. 'Fast fashion' means cheap clothes that become unfashionable very quickly, and the quality is often too bad to use again. People do not want to buy these clothes second-hand because they look worn out. Large amounts of these clothes have been thrown away as rubbish. Many clothes that charity shops cannot sell are sent to other countries, and this causes more problems for the economy and the environment there.

Some of today's adventurers are not happy with just one amazing trip, so they go from one challenge to another challenge. Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the highest mountain on each continent. She has also ridden a bike across Canada and run a long-distance race in the Sahara Desert when it was 45ºC hot. However, her most incredible journey was probably a skiing trip to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and someone had to rescue her. Many of us would have stopped trying at that point, but Meagan decided to continue. She reached the South Pole forty days later, even though she had pulled a sledge with a tent and all her food behind her. She did this through very cold conditions and ice storms.

Blek le Rat began by painting rats on the walls of Paris, which is his home city. These days, he wants to make people think about different social problems that affect society. He has painted pictures of homeless people in big cities because he wants local people to think more carefully about homelessness as a serious problem.

In some areas, local governments have tried to help artists so they don't paint graffiti anywhere they want on walls. They have created special places where artists can work. Taiwan is one place that has done this, and there are 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint and write on walls without problems. In São Paulo in Brazil, the city council has even allowed some graffiti artists to paint on the subway trains. This shows that some cities want to give artists proper places to do their work.

Faith47 comes from Cape Town in South Africa, and she has become well-known for creating street art. She paints large, colourful pictures of people and animals on walls, although she also likes to travel to different places to find new locations for her work. Her artwork can be discovered on pavements, inside empty factories, and even on old cars that previous owners have abandoned. 

She actually enjoys the fact that most street art doesn't last forever, because weather conditions or city workers will eventually remove it. This temporary nature appeals to her since it represents how life is constantly changing, with things that come to an end while new experiences begin. Even though her paintings might disappear, she believes this process shows the natural cycle of life that we all experience.

In her old job, Gabriela was used to a workplace where people respected power and authority very much, and everyone knew their place. In this type of workplace culture, the bosses make all the important decisions and workers do not often question them. However, her Swedish team was used to working in a very different way where workers often work together with their managers to find answers and make decisions. In this culture, the leaders act like coaches or teachers who help their workers think for themselves and expect them to ask questions or disagree sometimes.

When Gabriela understood that there were cultural differences between her and her team, she decided to talk openly with them about how they felt about her leadership style. Her team was happy because she asked for their opinions, so they told her honestly what they thought. They said they were not used to having someone tell them exactly what to do. They liked having more freedom to use their own ideas and be creative in their work. When Gabriela gave them very specific instructions about what she needed them to do, they felt that she didn't trust them to do their jobs well. The team members realized that Gabriela took it personally when they tried to question her decisions or suggest changes. However, they were able to explain to her that this was how they had always worked in their culture.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers who look exactly the same, and they come from São Paulo. They paint many different things, from small tags to very big, colourful pictures of people on building walls. Their artwork is often so huge that they have to use cranes because they cannot reach high places without help. In 2007, they painted an entire castle in Scotland, which means they covered every part of it with their colourful paint.

People have been painting and writing on walls for thousands of years, which shows how important this activity has always been. Long ago, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people inside caves because they wanted to tell stories about their lives. People have found graffiti on old buildings in countries like Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq, although many of these writings are very old now.

In the Roman town of Pompeii, scientists who study ancient history have found many examples of graffiti that was written in Latin. These messages include different topics about religion, politics and love, and they even found some magic spells that people believed would help them! This graffiti is important because it shows us how ordinary people lived and what they thought about during those times.

Have you ever dreamt of climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? If so, you're not alone. Every year, thousands of people have tried to climb the world's highest mountains or walk across continents, even though these journeys are extremely dangerous. Unlike the explorers of the past who could only use maps and compasses, today's adventurers travel with modern technology like GPS and satellite phones that help them stay safe. Many adventurers love nature and they use their travels to help people learn about environmental problems that might affect our future. Other adventurers want to help people who need support, so they raise money for charities while they travel because they believe their adventures should help others too.

The first method is called DART, which means the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. Scientists have decided to test DART on a small moon that goes around an asteroid called Didymos. This moon, which people call 'Didymoon', is about 150 metres wide, and it travels around its much larger mother asteroid that is 800 metres across. The scientists believe that when DART crashes into this moon, the impact will be strong enough to push it away from its usual path through space. If their plan works as expected, the telescopes that we have on Earth should be able to see this change in the moon's movement, although it might take some time to notice the difference.

The main character of the story is a sixteen-year-old girl called Katniss Everdeen, who has lost her father in a mining accident several years ago. Since then, she has had to find food for her family because they don't have enough money to buy what they need. She goes hunting in the woods around District 12 with her friend Gale, and she has become very skilled at using a bow and arrow through years of practice. When her younger sister, Prim, is chosen as one of the tributes for the Games, Katniss decides to volunteer so that she can go instead of her sister, even though this decision might cost her life. The other tribute from District 12 is a boy named Peeta, and Katniss soon discovers that her relationship with him is quite difficult and confusing because she cannot understand his true feelings toward her.

Writing about your dreams will help you remember more details about what happened while you were sleeping. You should think carefully about the people who appeared in your dream and the place where everything happened, because these things might be important for understanding what the dream actually means. If you write down your dreams every day for a week, you will be surprised by how much you have written during that time. After you have done this for several days, you can start to connect your dreams to the things that happen in your real life and discover how you feel about them. Although dreams can seem strange, they often show us things about our emotions that we might not notice when we are awake. However, you need to be patient because understanding dreams takes time, and you should keep writing even if the meaning is not clear at first.

In the past, most bridges were built from wood and could catch fire much more easily. This was especially true for old train bridges, where sparks were made when steel wheels moved on steel tracks. These sparks could sometimes make a bridge start burning, and the whole bridge would burn down completely.

We cannot predict exactly how street art will develop in the future, although we can already notice several interesting changes that are happening. Most street artists have always been young people who create their work in their own neighborhoods or cities where they have grown up. However, many street artists have recently started traveling to different countries so that they can paint in new places and learn from other cultures. Since the internet has become more popular, artists can now connect with each other online and share photographs of their artwork with people around the world. Even though street art was once considered illegal or unimportant, people in museums and galleries have begun to show more respect for this type of art because they believe it represents real artistic expression. While we might not know exactly what will happen to street art in the coming years, we can be confident that it will continue to be an important part of our cities and culture!

Suzanne Collins has always found news programmes about wars very upsetting, and this feeling started when she was young. When she was a child, her father worked as a pilot in the US Air Force, which meant he had to fight in the Vietnam War. Her mother tried to protect her from the truth because she didn't want to explain what was really happening in the war. However, Suzanne still saw news programmes about the fighting on television, so she understood that her dad was in a dangerous place. Even though her mother had tried to keep her safe from these worries, it was still a very frightening experience that would stay with her for many years.

A big company called PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) has done a survey around the world. They collected answers from more than 40,000 people about work topics. Some people were millennials, which means they were born between 1983 and 1993, while others were from different age groups. The survey asked questions about workplace culture, how people communicate at work, different working styles, how much people get paid, career development, and work-life balance.

Another big company called Deloitte has also done a global survey. More than 10,000 millennials took part in their study. This survey was about what millennials think are the main problems and good opportunities in today's complicated work world. The study wanted to understand how young workers see their future in the workplace.

Erik Weihenmayer from the United States is someone who has always loved challenging adventures, even though he faces difficulties that most people don't have. He has ridden his bike through the hot deserts of Morocco, which must have been incredibly difficult because of the heat and dangerous conditions. He has also used a kayak to travel through the Grand Canyon, and he has climbed Mount Everest, which is the highest mountain in the world. What makes Erik's story so amazing is that he has been completely blind since he was 13 years old, so he has achieved all these things without being able to see anything. When he is not traveling to different places around the world, he works hard to help other people with disabilities because he believes they should be able to live more active and exciting lives. He also takes groups of young blind people on mountain climbing trips because he wants to show them what they might be able to do if they try hard enough.

Online platforms that everyone can use are giving people a chance to make some quick money. For example, busy parents might not have wanted to set up a stall at the local market before because it was too much work. However, now they can use online marketplaces instead. Parents are able to sell baby clothes that their children have grown out of, even though the clothes have hardly been worn. They can also sell expensive pushchairs and baby equipment that they have bought. This way, they can get some money back, which helps them save cash for other things they need.

Pi and Richard Parker have spent 227 days in the lifeboat. They have lived through hunger, illness and feeling very tired. They have survived violent storms and the burning heat of the Pacific sun, although it was very difficult. Sometimes, Pi feels better because of his three religions, but other times he feels very lonely and hopeless. Finally, the Mexican coast appears far away and everything changes. It would be wrong to tell you the ending, so you will have to read the book yourself. You can find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they can see land.

Chloe arrived home from school and decided to make herself a cup of coffee. She carried it upstairs to her bedroom because she wanted to have some peaceful time alone. Although she had homework that needed to be completed, she thought she could finish it later in the evening. She really wanted to enjoy these quiet moments before her parents returned from work. When they came back, the house would definitely become much noisier with conversations, television programs, and her father's jazz music playing while he prepared dinner. She has always loved this particular time of day since it felt so calm and relaxing. She also appreciated these moments because she could spend time playing with her pet rats without anyone interrupting her or asking questions about her activities.

In 2010, NASA's team that protects our planet had found and recorded 90 per cent of the asteroids near Earth that are 1km wide. These objects are called 'near-Earth objects' or NEOs, and they are as big as mountains. Scientists include anything that comes within 50 million kilometres of Earth's path around the sun. NASA thinks there are about 50 more asteroids left to find and record. However, NASA says that none of the 887 asteroids they have already found will cause serious danger to our planet.

Auggie has decided to go to school, so now he has to face his first day. Like every child who starts at a new school, he feels really worried. However, because of the way he looks, it becomes a very painful experience. Nobody wants to sit next to him and he sees other kids looking at him or talking about him quietly. Luckily, he becomes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he talks with at lunch. But it's not just the first day that's difficult. Auggie soon finds out that his classmates don't want to touch him because they are afraid of catching 'the plague'. While he goes through the school year, Auggie has many strong good and bad times until finally something unexpected and shocking happens at a school camp that changes everything completely.

The two men looked towards the north side of the land. It went on as far as they could see. Even the fences were hard to see from where they were standing. However bored and angry a teenage boy might feel, he couldn't run away on foot from this place. Sam looked at the biggest horse, which was hitting the ground with its heavy feet. Could the boy ride a horse? he thought to himself. There was a lot of trouble that a good rider could cause out here, since they were miles away from other people. But maybe there would be even more trouble for someone who didn't know anything about horses and wanted to get away from his father.

Over 4,000 climbers have successfully reached the summit of Everest, and their ages have ranged from thirteen to eighty years old. Although climbing high mountains remains extremely dangerous because of freezing temperatures and severe storms, the world's most experienced climbers are now looking for new challenges to test their skills. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria developed her passion for mountain climbing when she was a teenager. After she completed her education, she found work as a nurse, however she kept climbing mountains during her free time because this activity had become so important to her.

After she had climbed Everest, Gerlinde decided that she would climb all fourteen of the world's highest mountains. These mountains are all more than 8,000 metres high, which makes them extremely dangerous. However, she wanted to make her challenge even more difficult, so Gerlinde always climbs without using oxygen tanks. This is very risky because there isn't enough oxygen at the top of such high mountains. When climbers don't get sufficient oxygen, their brain and body cannot function properly, and they might even die. Since Gerlinde has become famous as a mountain climber, she uses this reputation to help a charity organization. This charity supports poor children and children without parents in Nepal, although the work is challenging because these communities need so much help.

If we look at the things we have bought during our lives, we would see that we don't use everything we own well. For example, we might have bought a thick wool coat because it looked fashionable, even though we live in a hot country where we don't need it. We might have put away our old smartphone when we bought a newer one. We might have a car that we only use on weekends. We might even have a guest room in our house that has become a room where we keep old things we don't use.

Throughout history and across different cultures, people have believed that dreams could tell us about the future. They thought dreams were messages from gods, which were sent to give us special knowledge or help us understand things. Even today, many people can remember a time when they had a dream about something that happened, a place they visited, or a person they met, and then later, the same thing actually happened in their real life.

Some of the biggest and most expensive travel projects in the world have been about building bridges. Bridges are very important connections that help cars, trucks and trains cross water, deep valleys between mountains or other roads. Because of this, they are one of the most important parts of building work, and people watch them very carefully, especially when they fall down.

After weeks of feeling frustrated, Gabriela has sent an email to her Swedish manager because she was having problems with her team. Her manager asked her if she thought her team was still doing good work. He also asked what she believed would help her work better with her team members. However, Gabriela found her manager unclear and she didn't feel like he was dealing with the situation well enough. She thought he should have given her more help with the problem.

Dogs that live in groups have learned that humans will give food more easily to smaller, cuter dogs. Because of this, these dogs are sent out to ask for food for all the other dogs in their group. Some dogs have even learned how to use the city's underground train system so they can travel from one part of their area to another! Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when they should get off the train. One idea is that they use their very good sense of smell and have learned to remember the smells of places where they like to go. Another possibility is that they have learned to understand the names of train stations that they hear when announcements are made. However it works, people who travel on the underground trains have become so used to seeing dogs on the trains that most local people don't really notice them anymore.

Ed Stafford from the UK has become the first person who has successfully walked along the entire Amazon River. He began his incredible journey next to a small mountain stream in the Andes of Peru. After spending two years and four months walking through difficult conditions, he finally reached the place where the mighty river meets the Atlantic Ocean in Brazil. During this amazing adventure, he had covered approximately 6,000 kilometres on foot.

The Amazon rainforest is known as the home of extremely dangerous wildlife, including deadly snakes that could kill a person, aggressive crocodiles and powerful jaguars. Because of these threats, Ed was constantly facing serious danger throughout his journey. However, he was fortunate enough to survive this challenging expedition, even though he encountered many frightening situations. While he managed to avoid the most serious dangers, the worst problems he actually experienced were receiving thousands of painful bites from mosquitoes and ants, which made his daily progress very uncomfortable.

In Britain, the average person spends more than £1,000 on new clothes every year. This is around four per cent of the money they earn. That might not sound like a lot, however this number shows two problems that are much more serious for society and for the environment.

First, people buy a lot of these clothes with credit cards. British people now owe about £670 per adult to credit card companies. That's 66 per cent of the average money that people spend on clothes. Also, people are not only spending money they don't have, but they're also using it to buy things they don't really need.

Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing every year. Most of these clothes are put into landfill sites, which means they are buried in the ground as waste. This has become a big problem because people buy too many clothes and then get rid of them quickly.

Ed's walk would not have been possible without technology. He used a radio to ask the rainforest people for food and permission to cross their land. Many of them came to meet him and helped guide him through the most difficult areas. While Ed was walking, he wrote a blog because he wanted to record his daily experiences. He used the media interest in his trip so that he could protest about the destruction of the rainforest. He also wanted to raise money for environmental and children's charities in Brazil and Peru.

Businesses have learned that the sharing economy can make good money, so they want to get benefits from things that people don't use much. A business model that has become very popular quickly shows companies making online websites where customers can meet people who have products or services they need. Companies like Airbnb work as a middleman because they help people make money from rooms and houses they don't use by letting other people stay there. Another example is Uber, which asks people to use their own cars like taxis so they can earn extra money when they have free time.

One of the most important jobs that modern zoos do today is helping with international breeding programmes, especially for animals that might disappear forever. In the wild, some of the rarest animals have problems finding partners to have babies with, and they could also be in danger from hunters, loss of their homes and other animals that hunt them. A good zoo will help these species to live and have babies in a safe place. Also, when the numbers of some wild animals become smaller, there is more danger that groups of animals become too similar to each other. Breeding programmes give us protection against this problem: animals that have been born in zoos can be put back into the wild so that animal groups stay different from each other.

Both of these kinds of accidents do not happen very often, but boats and trains can make a bridge fall down for different reasons. With trains, it is how fast they hit the bridge that can make it collapse. With boats, it is because they are very heavy that can cause the bridge to fall down, even if they are moving slowly when this happens. The best way to stop bridge problems is to prepare for them. New technology that can find weak parts in bridges, safer places for workers and better bridge designs can all help to reduce these terrible accidents.

At first, Pi feels extremely frightened when he sees the wild animals on the lifeboat, so he quickly jumps into the ocean water. However, he suddenly remembers that there are dangerous sharks swimming in the dark water around him. He realizes that his only possible choice is to climb back onto the lifeboat, even though it's scary, because staying in the water would be much more dangerous for him. One by one, the frightened animals in the small lifeboat attack and kill each other until only Pi and the large tiger have survived this terrible situation. Fortunately for Pi, the tiger has already been given the human name Richard Parker by zoo workers, and this powerful tiger feels very seasick from the rough ocean waves. Because Richard Parker feels so ill and uncomfortable, he doesn't have any interest in hunting or eating Pi immediately.

When Pi is 16 years old, people choose a new government that his parents don't like at all. His parents are worried about what might happen in the future, so they decide to close their zoo and move their family to Canada. They have sold some of the animals to different zoos in North America, and the whole family travels by ship to reach Canada. They have taken many of the remaining animals with them on the long ship journey. While they are traveling across the ocean, there is a terrible storm and the ship goes down into the deep sea. Sadly, Pi's family and all the sailors on the ship drown in the dark water, but Pi manages to get into a small lifeboat that was floating nearby. However, he soon discovers that he is not alone in the boat because there is a dangerous hyena, an injured zebra, a large orang-utan and a very big tiger sharing the small space with him.

The Hunger Games has become one of the most successful books that teenagers and young adults have ever read. Suzanne Collins, who is an American writer, created this exciting story that millions of people around the world now love. Since publishers first released the book in 2008, it has been translated into 26 different languages, which shows how popular it has become internationally.

The book has achieved something quite special because it has sold millions of copies worldwide. Even more impressive is that it became the first young adult novel that has managed to sell over one million electronic copies, which was a major success in the digital book market.

Hollywood producers decided to turn The Hunger Games into a major film, and the movie has been just as successful as the original book. During its opening weekend in North America alone, the film earned an incredible 152.5 million dollars, which proves how much audiences were excited to see this story on the big screen. This amazing success demonstrates that both the book and movie have captured people's imagination in a powerful way.

Maybe dreams happen because our mind connects the thoughts we have experienced during the day, although these thoughts appear in dreams with different meanings than we might expect. When we are awake, our thoughts usually come to our minds as words, which is similar to conversations we have with ourselves inside our head. However, when we are asleep, the part of our brain that controls language becomes less active, while the part that controls our emotions and feelings becomes much more active than usual. This could explain why dreams often feel so strange and emotional, even though they might be based on normal things that happened to us during the day. Since our language skills are not working properly while we sleep, our brain has to express these daily experiences through pictures and feelings instead of clear words.

Having good relationships is very important if you want to be happy. Scientists have done a study about this topic. They found that most happy people have strong connections with their friends and family members. These people also make sure they spend time with the people they care about on a regular basis.

You also need at least one person who you can talk to about your personal feelings. This is called 'self-disclosure', which means sharing your private thoughts with someone you trust. Just one person is enough for these deep conversations, although you should also have other relationships too. It's not enough to have many friends who you only do activities with or chat to about things like music or football. That deeper connection with someone is the most important thing.

Some people might need to learn how to listen well to others. This skill could help them build stronger relationships with the people around them.

Carol Dweck is a psychologist who believes in something called 'growth mindset'. She has studied how our brains can change and grow throughout our lives. This means we can get better at skills, even if we were not good at them when we started.

Many people like to praise the final results and the natural talents that someone has. For example, they might say 'You are really good at seeing details' or 'You have a real talent for organizing events'. However, research has shown that this way might not help people improve their abilities.

Instead, we should focus on how people do things. We should praise their effort and their willingness to try new things. We should also praise the ways they solve problems. When we do this, we help people develop new skills better. We can also help them continue to get better at the talents they already have. This method works much better than just praising someone's natural ability. This is because it makes people want to keep trying, even when things become difficult.

The rover checks the air around it from time to time, and in 2014 it discovered that the air had another very simple organic molecule in it. This molecule is methane, which is an important part of natural gas. Methane has one special feature - it can only stay in the air for a few hundred years before it disappears. This means that something on Mars must be making new methane all the time to replace what has gone away. NASA scientists have found that Mars sends out thousands of tons of methane at once. The amount of methane goes up and down during different seasons of the year, almost like the planet is breathing the gas in and out.

When Carol Dweck was starting her work as a psychologist at Stanford University, she did a test with ten-year-old children. She gave them problems that were a bit too difficult for them to solve. One group of children had a positive reaction to this challenge. They said they loved trying hard things because they understood that they could get better at things if they practiced. Dweck says these children had a 'growth mindset', which means they focus on what they might be able to do in the future if they keep trying.

However, the other group of children felt very different about the test. They thought Dweck was testing how smart they were, and they believed they had failed. These children had what Dweck calls a 'fixed mindset', which means they could not imagine that they would ever get better at these problems. Some of these children even said they might cheat on tests in the future. Others started looking for children who had done worse than them so they could feel better about themselves.

Horror films really like places where nobody lives anymore. This might be an old hospital that people have left, a frightening empty house, or a town where no one lives now. There's something special about lonely, empty places that makes us feel strange. What was life like when people used to live there? Why did they decide to go away? Maybe it's also because these places are so quiet, which can make us feel very scared too. Of course, empty places are also useful for horror film makers because it seems more real that your phone won't work there either.

No matter what type of house it is, the basement is always a frightening place in horror movies. That's usually where something dangerous is hiding or where the evil person has put their weapons. Basements are always dark and they are often wet too. You can only get to them if you go down a narrow staircase. Even though there might not be anything down there, basements are always scary because they feel strange and uncomfortable.

Gary Collins was a policeman who was not working at the time. He was watching the London riots on TV during his holiday. He could recognize several people immediately, so he decided to stop his holiday early. He wanted to help the police identify who these people were.

Collins ended up working for six months while he looked through all the CCTV camera recordings. He managed to identify 190 people from the videos. He could often recognize people just by looking at their eyes, which was quite amazing. His help was very important for the police investigation because he was so good at this work.

The police had 200,000 hours of video recordings from the riots. However, even though they used special computer software that should recognize faces, it could only identify one person. This shows how much better Collins was at recognizing people than the computer technology.

Personally, I think it's really interesting to think about how we will make our evolution faster as humans by adding technology to our bodies. Imagine if you could put a small computer inside your brain! Soon we will be able to do exactly that, and it will help us become better at math, seeing and hearing things, and remembering information. This idea is going to become more and more normal in the future, even though it might sound strange now.

It was a really interesting talk and the speaker was right about several important things. Take how parents influence their children, for example. How can we expect teenagers not to send messages while they are doing their homework when they see their parents using social media while they cook dinner or wait at traffic lights? She also made a good point about people who want to be in two or more places at the same time. So they keep changing between their real conversations and their online conversations. I see this happening all the time with my teenage daughter and her friends. They plan to meet each other and then they sit together without talking while each person has a different conversation online.

When we read news stories, we often think the world is becoming more violent. However, there are some good reasons to feel hopeful about this. From the end of World War II until 1990, there were 30 wars that killed more than 100,000 people each. Today, there are still civil wars in some places, but most countries are living together more peacefully than they did before. 

However, terrorism has increased a lot in recent years. Also, since World War II ended, wars have killed many more ordinary people than soldiers. Even so, the numbers about ordinary people are not all bad news. Although people are nine times more likely to die because of violent crime than because of political fighting, the number of murders around the world has gone down. In 2000, there were 8 murders for every 100,000 people, but by 2015 this number had fallen to about 5.3 people.

Wasfia has spent her life helping with human rights and she has seen many international projects in her country that were meant to help and teach women and girls. However, these projects often left people with nothing when they finished. Wasfia realized that Bangladesh needed to help itself, so she decided to bring together two things she loved - mountain climbing and human rights. She wanted to change how people think about women in her country. She first started climbing when she was working on help campaigns in Tibet and Nepal, because Bangladesh is a flat country near the sea where most people have never seen a mountain. Her campaign seems to be working well because people in her country and around the world are starting to pay attention to what she is doing.

Most people believe that poor countries are in a terrible situation. They think these countries have serious poverty, bad leaders who control everything, and no hope that things will improve. However, this view is not correct at all. The reality is quite different because major changes have been taking place around the world.

During the last 20 years, more than 700 million people have started earning more money and they are no longer living in poverty. Additionally, six million fewer children die each year because of diseases. Millions more girls have gained access to education now, and millions of people have been able to get clean drinking water. This demonstrates that life has improved significantly for many people, although most of us are not aware of these positive developments.

These improvements have happened because governments and organizations have been working together to solve problems. Even though we still hear bad news about poor countries, we should remember that progress has been made in many areas of life.

Many managers try to make their feedback more positive by putting negative comments between two positive ones. However, when feedback becomes too much like a routine, employees can start to think that positive feedback is just a way to make the negative parts sound better. This makes the positive feedback less valuable. Instead, positive feedback should not just be used to make negative feedback easier to accept. It should be given in a way that helps workers feel good about their performance and encourages them to keep doing well.

I'm a member of the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. You should forget the scary movie pictures of robots that kill people and think about what is happening right now. Military machines like drones, gun towers and guard robots are already being used to kill people, although humans don't control them very much. The next step will be robots that can work completely alone. These 'killer robots' would follow orders, but they would decide who to kill by themselves. I think this would be completely wrong and dangerous for all people. We really need to be very careful about what we ask machines to do, because the results could be terrible.

Overall, more people are learning English than all the other languages together, and English is spoken in more countries than any other language. However, Chinese has much more native speakers than English does. It seems that there is not much connection between how many native speakers a language has and how many people want to learn it. But there is a stronger connection between the number of learners and how many countries use that language. This might be because people choose to learn languages that they can use in many different places around the world.

Your manager stops you and says she needs to talk about how you worked on the recent project. You feel worried about it all weekend because you wonder what you might have done wrong. When you go into her office on Monday morning, she starts by saying good things about your work on the project. However, you wonder if this is just the nice words that always come before bad news. You know how this kind of talk usually goes: first they say something nice, then they say what they really think, and then they say something nice again. This is what people call the 'feedback sandwich' - it's like putting the bad news between two pieces of good news.

A fast rock album with songs you can dance to, Born in the USA has lyrics that carry deep feelings. Behind the exciting rock music that makes these powerful songs are stories about the difficult side of the American dream. Many songs talk about the problems that ordinary working people have and the angry feelings they get when life doesn't give them money or success. The song Glory Days, for example, is about people in a small town who think back to when they were young and felt they could do anything, while Downbound Train tells the story of a young man whose life goes wrong when he loses his job. It's easy to think that the artist is writing about real people he has known and the life he might have lived if he hadn't become famous. The album will show you clearly that the Boss has amazing and special talent.

Lewis wants to see more protected areas in the oceans around the world. Right now, only 3 per cent of the sea has protection, but he thinks this should grow to 10 per cent. This would help fix the damage that people have caused through activities like catching too many fish, making the water dirty, and throwing rubbish into the sea.

When Lewis has travelled to different places, he has seen this environmental damage with his own eyes. He has swum over coral reefs that have lost their colour because the water temperature has become too hot. He has also seen underwater areas in the Red Sea that look like empty deserts. These places have no sea life left and are covered with plastic waste instead.

Pugh believes that nature can get better again if we give it enough space to recover. However, time is running out quickly. If we don't start taking care of our oceans soon, we might face a problem that we cannot solve anymore.

Best-selling author Terrie Sharp knows how to tell good stories, and she has won the Olive Crime Writer Award two times. She was born on a housing estate in Glasgow where crime happened more often than in other places. While she was growing up there, she learned to keep quiet and stay out of trouble. She even learned how to open car doors with a knife. However, she has only used this knowledge to write her novels, so she never got into real trouble. She is not so quiet these days because she appears on popular daytime TV shows like Police Today. She also speaks at writing conferences all around the UK, where she shares her experience with other writers.

Are things getting worse every day? Is it impossible to make progress? In his book Enlightenment Now, Steven Pinker has looked at the big picture of human progress, and he has found good news. We are living longer, healthier, freer and happier lives than before. However, Pinker says that the real problem is different. The values of thinking clearly and using science are under attack from some people. When news writers and political leaders try to make people feel afraid of other groups, they also make people believe that nothing can change. This creates distrust between people. If this continues, Pinker argues, we might cause serious damage to important things like democracy. We could also harm the way countries work together around the world.

In old horror movies, when the main characters were in terrible trouble, it was hard or impossible for them to call for help or call the police. Mobile phones have made that situation less believable now. What can movie makers do to keep the excitement? No phone signal! If you are the hero in a horror movie, you can be almost sure that at an important moment, just when you really need to call for help, your phone will not work at all. Or your phone battery will die while you are making the call. Or both things will happen.

In the 1950s, banana companies in Central America faced a serious problem that would change their business forever. Their most important banana variety, which was called the Gros Michel banana, was dying from disease. People also called it Big Mike because of its large size. Now the same dangerous situation is happening again to the banana that replaced Big Mike - the Cavendish banana that we eat today.

The Gros Michel banana had been perfect for international business because it had thick skin that protected it well. This meant it could travel long distances to different countries without getting damaged during transport. It also tasted very sweet and had a strong banana flavor, which customers around the world loved. Because of these excellent qualities, this type of banana had been grown on almost every banana farm across Central America's plantations.

United Fruit was the biggest banana company in South America at that time, and they controlled most of the banana trade. They wanted to produce as many bananas as possible while keeping their costs as low as they could. So they used a special farming method that seemed very smart - they didn't grow new banana plants from seeds like most other crops. Instead, they took small shoots from the stems of existing healthy plants and grew new plants from these shoots. This process is called cloning, and it creates plants that are exactly the same. They also planted all these banana plants very close together in their fields so they could grow more bananas in smaller areas and make more money.

Most spiders have venom in their bodies, and they use this poison to stop or kill the animals they want to eat. They don't use their venom to attack people. Scientists have found that only 25 types of spiders can actually hurt humans with their poison. Although spider bites might be painful, they almost never kill people. Australia has a dangerous spider called the Sydney funnel-web spider, but no one has died from its bite since doctors made special medicine in 1981. However, you should be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas because you don't want to make them angry. When these spiders feel scared or think someone might hurt them, they protect themselves in a special way. They shoot out a cloud of tiny hairs that can irritate skin. These annoying hairs stick into the skin or eyes of whatever is trying to attack them.

This frightening movie concept has been extremely popular with horror films since the late 1900s. It usually begins with a group of teenagers who are enjoying themselves and having a good time, although it always finishes with everyone dead except for one girl. At the beginning, this girl is typically innocent and shy, and she doesn't seem very strong or confident. However, by the end of the movie, she has developed into the strongest and most intelligent person you could possibly imagine. The final girl character almost always manages to survive and win when the story concludes, even though she seemed like the least likely person to do so at the start.

If we want to understand where our ability for difficult language came from, we need to look at how our brains are different from other animals. This is about more than just brain size, although that matters too. It is important to know what other things our brains can do and when they developed that way. However, there are very few physical signs that can help us with this question. The objects that our early family members left behind don't tell us what kind of speech they could make.

One thing we can see in the bones of early humans is how the mouth, throat and tongue changed over time. Scientists have found that by about 100,000 years ago, humans had developed the ability to make complex sounds. Before that time, scientists who study how humans developed can only guess about this. They don't know if early humans talked to each other using more basic sounds or not.

Society tells us that girls should like arts subjects and leave maths and physics to boys - this is not something natural. Also, young people do not see enough positive female role models who work in science jobs. Cartoons and stories usually show the crazy scientist, clever inventor, or brave astronaut as a man. What is more, many people wrongly think that scientists are strange people who have poor social skills or that their work is lonely and separate from the rest of the world. These are false ideas that the media shows us, but they might mean that girls do not connect with scientists. Because of this, girls see science as a career path that does not interest them. If girls could see more positive female role models in science, it would give them more confidence. They would also feel that they belong more in those subjects.

The Scallion has been published every week for several years, and students can collect it free from various university buildings across campus. Approximately 10,000 students have read it each week, which shows how popular it has become. Students write all the articles and produce the entire newspaper themselves, so they gain valuable experience while they work on it. A recent study has revealed that both university students and teachers believe the paper is extremely important for campus life. They value it because it provides entertainment during their free time, helps them learn about different cultural topics, and offers practical work experience that students might use in their future careers.

However, the newspaper faces several challenges that could affect its future. Printing costs have increased significantly, which means the budget is always tight. Although the paper is free, some students find it difficult to get copies since they must visit the university buildings to pick them up. There is also an environmental concern that has worried many people. Even though thousands of copies are distributed, many become waste that students leave around the campus, which creates litter problems everywhere and damages the university's appearance.

At Girox Foods, we have been facing a serious problem with workers leaving their jobs. Every year, about 12 per cent of our employees decide to leave the company, which has become quite worrying. Although this might not seem like a major issue, other companies in our industry only lose seven per cent of their workers each year. Since our numbers are much higher than average, we need to take action quickly.

The main goal of this report is to discover why employees are not satisfied at work. We want to understand what makes workers choose to stay or leave our company. Even though some people might think money is the only reason, there could be other important factors that we haven't considered yet. After we have identified the real reasons behind this problem, we will suggest practical ideas about how to improve the workplace environment.

If we can successfully make these changes, more employees would want to stay with the company for a longer time. However, we must act soon because losing experienced workers costs us money and affects our business performance.

So much of what the speaker said was true. I really believe there's a danger that when we are more connected, we might feel more alone. I don't think this is such a big problem for my generation because we have lived without technology for so long. We know how to be alone and, more importantly, we know that it's OK to be alone. However, people under 20 are completely different. They are so busy sending messages to each other that they never experience the feeling of being alone. Because of this, they might not learn how to enjoy spending time by themselves. Also, they are learning how to talk through messages that can be changed and corrected. This means they are not learning the skill of real conversation that happens immediately with the person who is standing in front of you.

Don't always give positive feedback and then negative feedback together. When positive and negative comments always come at the same time, people might not value the good things you say. They could start to ignore the positive words because they expect bad news to follow. You should make sure there are times when you only give positive feedback. This means you tell someone they have done well without adding any criticism. You might feel like you want to help them improve by pointing out problems, but you should resist this feeling sometimes. If you always mix good and bad feedback together, the good feedback won't have the same effect on people.
